direction.raw_text: When you hear thunder... A black bowling ball pulls away from the lens. The ball is in the hands of THEO SKINNER, an intense, handsome 28 year old man with sideburns dressed in worn bowling attire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...God is bowling. He holds the ball in front of him, wristbrace on, his face a study in concentration.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : CREDITS
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 2     EXT. BRIDGE - DAY                                     2 An empty causeway spans a bay somewhere along the south shore of Long Island. The sky is overcast. SHEILA, a woman in her late twenties, wearing a full length heliotrope pleather coat over a waitress outfit, kneels in the middle of the road. A souped-up Vespa motor scooter stands nearby. KEN AND BARBIE Sheila holds a Bridal Barbie and Ken doll set. She sets them down on the road, pulls out a can of lighter fluid and soaks the dolls. She pulls out a bowling pin-shaped lighter and torches the nuptial tableau. 3     INT. THEO'S CAR                                       3 Theo drives his ratty old American car along a highway. The car has Ohio plates. He sucks coffee from a 7-Eleven "Big- Swig" cup and examines a map. A yellow plastic "Bowler on Board" sign is stuck to a side window. Theo's music PLAYS. His eyes nod off, then snap awake. 4     NIGHTMARE                                                4 The screen is black, except for three circles in the middle of the screen. The light shining through them is snuffed out by three large pink objects. There is a loud POP, like a thumb being pulled out of a tight hole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A slow motion low tracking shot of a bowling ball hitting a polished lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close-up of the milky white surface of two bowling pins on opposite sides of the lane - a seven-ten split. The RUMBLING ball is heard in the distance like a furious hulking steamroller of doom. The pins begin to tremble, and then transform into a Bridal Ken and Barbie. The dolls burst into flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball blasts past the camera and metamorphoses into Theo's car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 5     EXT. BRIDGE                                         5 Theo's sedan blasts past the camera down the empty road.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The flaming couple stand in the middle of the bridge. Theo's car hits the pair and they fly into the air in slow-motion. A distant SOUND of pins scattering is heard. The two dolls smoke as they spin into the sky, then hit the water with dual HISSES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 6     PIN RESET MACHINERY                                   6 An American Machine and Foundry pin reset machine performs its functions like a mechanical ballet as the camera follows a bowling ball through its journey. The "Spare Me!" theme MUSIC (similar to "Balboa Blue" by the Marketts) swells. TITLE: SPARE ME! appears on the bowling ball. Pins tumble across the back plate, are loaded into the pin conveyor, lifted up to the crown feeder, distributed into the rotating carousel, and then set down in perfect formation upon the polished bowling alley. BURN-IN PRINCIPAL PLAYER TITLES. Titles appear on the pins. The ball trundles along the return trough straight into the lens. BLACK 7     INT. 7-ELEVEN - DAY                                   7 A muzak cover of 'Broke, Busted, and Disgusted' PLAYS in the background as Theo gingerly pulls a hot taco out of the microwave oven. ALFIE, the rickety old man who runs the store, shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wiping it down. Theo pokes at the taco with a spork as steam rises. He pulls a disgusted grimace. Alfie pours himself a cup of coffee and then attempts to open a tiny container of half & half. Because his hands are shaking so much, the cream goes everywhere but into the coffee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I'm an addict. I can't go through a day without the stuff. Theo reaches over and pours for him with a steady hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not from around here, are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm from Akron. Alfie looks at Theo's bowling shoe attired feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a bowler? Theo's hand starts shaking uncontrollably. He puts down the cream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bowler. Alfie presses a matchbook into Theo's hand and then trundles off. Theo looks down at the matchbook; it reads "Bowl for health, enjoy yourself. Babylon Lanes." 8     EXT. BABYLON LANES - TWILIGHT                           8 Theo pulls into the empty parking lot of Babylon Lanes beside a cheap looking American sedan. 9     INT. BABYLON LANES                                    9 Theo walks into an empty run-down forty lane bowling alley carrying his ball bag. It is dark. The fluorescent lights switch on and the pin re-set machines whirr into action. SID and BREEZE, two shady looking guys in a basement-sale suits walk up lane dividers towards Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lane's closed big fellah, league night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not here to bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gesturing to Theo's bag) You drag that coconut around for your health, or do you know how to use it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bristling at the challenge) I'm looking for somebody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, ain't I seen you on the tour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, pinhead, he ain't here to bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm looking for Buzz Fazeli. Sid and Breeze look sideways at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fazeli...I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want with old man Faz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some unfinished business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wanna do business in this town, there's other people around here got more weight than old Faz. A lady dwarf walks by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening Sid, evening Breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evening Tina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck tonight Tina. Tina opens a door and goes down some stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys got something going on downstairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We provide some extracurricular activities for the senior citizens in the community.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Basement bingo? Breeze sniggers into his hand
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smirks) Yeah, basement bingo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme see your ball. Breeze grabs Theo's bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let go of my bag. Sid sidles around behind Theo who tries to keep him in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, come on, lemme see your ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You afraid we're gonna steal it? Breeze unzips the bag and pulls the ball out. Theo's temper is rising, he breathes deeply. He is obviously making a Herculean effort to keep himself in check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, let go of my bag. With lightning speed Theo's hand shoots out and grabs the middle fingers on Sid's right hand. Sid howls in agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aagh! Stop! Those are my bowling fingers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell your little pal to let go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breeze, give him his ball back! Breeze, astonished, drops Theo's ball into the bag. Sid cringes in front of Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can I find Buzz Fazeli?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, cool your maples. Over the bridge, past the Peter Pan, last house on the dead end. Theo releases Sid's hand. Sid drops to his knees and cradles his damaged hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't seen a ball like that since '69.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It belonged to my dad. Theo turns and walks out. 10     EXT. WOODS - NIGHT                                   10 JUNIOR, a dumpy man in his late thirties with a rat tail, bad skin and wearing a white straitjacket and fluorescent orange pants, runs desperately through dark woods. Bloodhounds BARK in the distance. 11     EXT. ROAD - NIGHT                                    11 Theo drives over the draw-bridge and past the Peter Pan Diner with its huge neon sign. 12     EXT. DEAD END STREET                                 12 Theo's car pulls up in front of a modest suburban house. A rooftop weather vane in the shape of a bowler CREAKS ominously in the wind. 13     EXT. BUZZ'S HOUSE                                    13 Theo rings the doorbell. The porch light comes on, and MILLIE, a fifty-five year-old woman dressed for a night on the town in Reno, but with fuzzy slippers and a hairnet, opens the door. A miniscule neurotic poodle leaps at Theo's bowling ball bag, YAPPING and snapping at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Mr. Fazeli in please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who wants to know? (to dog) Zeus!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a bowler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick of you people. Why don't you leave him be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him in, Millie. And don't frisk him. 14     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         14 Millie and Theo, with Zeus hot on his trail, enter the room. BUZZ FAZELI, a sixty-five year-old man shaped a lot like a compressed bowling pin, slouches in a recliner. The room is decorated with trophies of Buzz's bygone pro-bowling halcyon days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh sure. Let everyone in. From now on I leave the door wide open. Let the parade begin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clam it! Millie is silent. Buzz gets up and approaches Zeus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, rat. C'mere. Zeus growls at Buzz as he comes nearer, then clamps onto his sleeve and hangs from his arm, growling ferociously. In one smooth motion, Buzz flings the rabid poodle through an open window and into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jerk. She heads outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down. Theo sits on the edge of the couch. Buzz puts out his hand. Theo shakes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz Fazeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know your face, you're an up-and-comer. You bowl on the tour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not on the tour this year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods understandingly) Need some advice, huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Fazeli, the Bowling Congress says I'm a thorn in their side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dismissive wave) Don't worry about the Congress, they're just a bunch of moralistic busy-bodies. 15     EXT. THEO'S CAR                                      15 Millie's furry slippers protrude from the driver's side door. Zeus chews furiously on the yellow plastic 'Bowler On Board' sign. She rifles through the contents of the overstuffed glove compartment. She notices her dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under her breath) Get that outta your mouth! 16     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         16 THEO They suspended me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd they suspend you? Theo's eyes glaze over, the lights in the room dim, and Buzz seems to recede into the far distance. 17     TV SCREEN - FLASHBACK                                17 In ultra-slow scan we see an image of two bowlers, one is smiling cockily to off-screen fans and waving, the other is Theo, his face filled with hate, winding up to smash the other man in the head with his bowling ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't really my fault. In the far background the hollow booming VOICE of a judge delivers sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The American Bowling Congress hereby suspends Theo Maynard Skinner from all professional bowling activities within the jurisdiction of the American Bowling Congress and its international co- signers... The ball mashes into the smirking mans head, causing it to snap forward. The judge's gavel BANGS and the crowd ROARS. 18     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         18 Theo snaps out of it, the room lights come up, and Buzz leans in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got suspended when I was young, too. I was pretty cocky in my day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They suspended me for 100 years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: years! (knits his brow)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can appeal in five. I was hoping you could help me Mr. Fazeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uneasy) What do you think I can do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sweating slightly) I need a sponsor to get my sanction card back. Where I come from, you're the king.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, around here, any fat old bald guy could be king. I'm nothing. It wouldn't do any good for me to talk to the Congress. (briskly changing subject) Hey, you thirsty? You like orange whips?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never had orange whips, I'm from Akron.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 19     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, KITCHEN                                 19 Millie and Buzz are in the kitchen, talking in loud whispers. Millie fills a blender while Buzz cuts oranges.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He's the guy Buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not the guy, Millie. Just whip the whips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I looked in his car. He's got pictures of you, clippings, maps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowlers don't go around killing other bowlers. He's only a fan, Millie. I'll give him some tips and an autograph and he's outta here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in trouble, aren't you Buzz? You're doing something dangerous in that alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Millie, I know what I'm doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should leave this town. I can't take this anymore. I'm not gonna let him kill you in my house. 20     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         20 Buzz rejoins Theo in the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember the finals in Akron in '59? You had a seven-ten split in the final frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, against that prick VanDeMark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten thousand to one, but you pegged it. The toughest shot on the last frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That game was before you was born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom was there. She told me about it. The 'Fazeli Split.' 21     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, KITCHEN                                 21 The blender is wailing at high speed as Millie throws in a whole box of laxative, a can of Drano and a jar of pills. Her hands are trembling. 22     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         22 Millie walks into the living room with a silver tray holding two orange whips; one thick and deadly, the other thin and safe. There is laughter coming from both men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the irony is, thirty years later, that prick is bowling in the seniors on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all over the world, and look at me. Ah well. The docs made me stop, on account of my ticker. (taps his chest) I don't really miss it, but then... (chokes up) ...I miss it. He spies Millie approaching with the tray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Orange whip, nectar of the bowling gods. Thanks sweetie. Millie turns the tray so that Buzz takes the untainted whip.  Theo takes the other glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zeus is on the sofa, GROWLING and tugging at Theo's bowling bag. The bag rips apart and the ball hits the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo brings the drink to his lips. The ball rolls across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball rolls into Buzz's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This your lucky bullet? Buzz picks it up and reads the writing on the ball. He snaps a look into the kitchen, seeing the empty Drano and laxative cartons. Buzz slams the drink away from Theo's lips. The drink explodes across the room. Buzz is up on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with intensity) Where'd you get this ball?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned - looks at the mess on the floor, then at Buzz) It's mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who gave it to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grace Skinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (astonished) Grace Skinner. Who's Grace Skinner to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my mom. Theo stands and takes the ball from Buzz's hands. Buzz is in shock, staring at Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (regaining his voice) Who are you? Who sent you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your son. You're a hard father to find.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Millie) Millie, please. (to Theo) I don't have a son. I think you better leave now young man. Buzz gestures towards the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calmly) Grace Skinner Fazeli, you must remember her? Buzz takes Theo by the elbow to eject him from the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know no Grace Skinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulls his arm away) You knew her. You married her in 1963.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Married? Buzz grabs a large bowling trophy and waves it at Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a bullshit artist, that's what you are. You got no right to be here! Theo yanks the trophy away from Buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a right. You're my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't nobody's father! Theo hurls the trophy at Buzz. He ducks and the trophy sails into a large glass trophy case. Broken glass and trophies fly everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (noticing Zeus)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Zeus is laid out cold near the spilled orange whip on the living room floor. Millie hunches over her comatose poodle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My poor baby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Theo) You see what you did? (he picks up the ball) Take your ball and get out. Theo takes the ball and exits the house. 23     EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT                                  23 Theo, bathed in sweat, practices his release form with obsessive determination. He is alone near the empty bridge. Sheila spies on him from behind the bridge control booth. Theo takes a long slug from a bottle of liquor. He hears a motor scooter start and ROAR off into the night. 24     INT. 7-ELEVEN - DAY                                  24 Theo stands at the self-serve island sipping coffee. A muzak cover of 'Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head' PLAYS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (resignedly)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: years, 241 days, (looks at his watch)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hours, and 20 minutes of no bowling. Alfie shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wiping it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find your bowler?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but it didn't go so good. He wasn't the man I thought he'd be. Theo is trying to affix the lid on his cup, but his hands are trembling, spilling some of the coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father used to say to me "Never..." no, hmmm. "Always..." No, no... (puzzles) Ah! Love and hate are blood relations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe I should have left the ball in the car. 25     EXT. BUZZ'S HOUSE - DAY                                    25 Millie kneels on the front lawn patting dirt down on a little grave marked by a wooden cross. Theo walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about Zeus, Millie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to grave) This is a sign! Someone's coming to take Buzz away from me. I don't know if you're the guy or what, but I'm not letting it happen. I'm leaving him first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't kill Buzz. I need his help. Theo helps Millie load suitcases into the trunk of her car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz Fazeli never helps anybody but himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's my father, Millie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's no father to you. Theo lifts a box full of new bowling pins into the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful with that one. He won't tell me anything, but I know there's something strange going on over at the lanes. If you ask me, I'd say the old fart wants to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where can I find him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at her watch) The Peter Pan. Millie gets into the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tell Buzz I went to my sister's in Ronkonkoma. Oh, I'm sorry about trying to kill you last night, Theo. It was nothing personal. Millie puts on a pair of sunglasses and patches out in a cloud of gravel and dust. 26     INT. PETER PAN DINER - DAY                                 26 A blender WHIRRS. Sheila, in her waitress uniform, carefully chops something. She watches an indoor motocross rally on the diner's color TV. 12-PACK, a hefty construction worker, sits at the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Sheila, how's that orange whip comin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mimicking him under her breath) How's that orange whip comin'? THWAP! Sheila is dismembering a Ken doll with a big knife. She scoops the parts into the blender and switches from purZe to frappZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I heard Junior busted out again? Sheila puts the glass down in front of 12-Pack with a THUNK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Sheila, you can whip my oranges anytime. Sheila puts a Barbie head earring on her left ear. Buzz comes into the diner and slides into a booth. Sheila walks over with a pot of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cup of joe Mr. Fazeli?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and make it extra muddy, I didn't sleep a zee last night. Sheila fills a cup. Buzz lifts it to his mouth, his hands trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need coffee, Mr. Fazeli; you need a vacation. Sheila catches sight of Theo pulling into the parking lot. She puts a Ken head earring in her right ear. Buzz follows Sheila's gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (groans) Some people will do anything for an autograph. Theo enters the diner and walks over to Buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Millie left to stay with her sister in Ronkonkoma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what a mixer ball is? It's like you, you come out of nowhere and upset things, scattering everything all over. Buzz grumpily waves at him to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing over at the lanes that's so dangerous, Buzz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't listen to her, she's a nervous old Nellie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She thinks someone's trying to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't pay someone enough to try to kill me. Sheila comes over to take their orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have my usual please, Sheila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz Burger, side of 'cues. You haven't introduced me to your fan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheila, meet...uh... (leans in to Theo, sardonically) I forget the name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uncomfortably) Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo! This is Sheila Kastle, my partner's daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eyeing Theo up and down) You look like you're something on the lanes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo's bowled on the tour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, a professional man. What'll you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your specialty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whips...orange whips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll have the number four with one of your finest whips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you want it? (their eyes meet) The eggs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (discomfited at the blatant double entendre) Uh...over easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming right up. Sheila smiles and walks away. Theo watches her slink behind the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch out for that one. She's got a great average, but she's looking for a prince. And, believe me, she's (more)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: kissed a lotta tadpoles. (looking Theo in the eye) Listen, I been thinking about your problem. I'm not the guy to sponsor you. It would be unethical. But, there is something I could do for you. (leans in, secretively) Putt-putt golf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Putt-putt golf? Buzz pulls a golf ball from his pocket, flashes it and slips it back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the next level, the next dimension... (deep conviction) ...the small ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in Buzz's spell) The small ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna be bigger than big. Think Europe. Think Asia. They don't have room for real golf courses in Japan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snapping out of it) Not for me. Miniature golf's for pansies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If the Japanese are pansies, then pansies are my kind of people. Sheila steps over to the booth with their food. The Buzz Burger has three holes cut in the middle to make it look like a bowling ball. Buzz sees the two sleazeballs park their car and walk towards the diner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pondering the thought) Maybe I could bowl in Japan. Buzz stands up abruptly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta wash up. Buzz heads for the rest rooms. The door opens with a JINGLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three whips. To go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you get a chance. Sid and Breeze walk over to Theo's booth and slide in. Sid's middle fingers are taped to an aluminum splint. The BLENDER kicks into action. Buzz watches the group from the bathroom hall and tries to catch the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking for Buzz Fazeli, seen him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look Sid, a Buzz Burger. The Faz's favorite lunch. Sid reaches for the plate. Buzz walks over to the booth  and pulls his burger away from Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from that burger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry Faz, we didn't know you was here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz, Mr. Kastle wants to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Theo and Buzz) Are you guys bruddas? The booth party is silent for a moment. Theo LAUGHS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we ain't brothers.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (surprised) No. Do You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not at the present. EXT. PARKING FIELD - NIGHT Sheila and Theo toast marshmallows over the barbecue as the rest of the party dances in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this brother of yours is hazardous to the health of your dates?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody in this town really understands Junior. When I went to family sessions for him I realized he was the sanest one in the family. Actually, he's the only one in this whole fucking town who knows exactly who he is and what he wants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfortunately what he wants is you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, what about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I want you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get into that later.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 48     INT. MILES KASTLE'S OFFICE                                 48 Alone, Kastle stares at the bank of video monitors and runs a battery powered fuzzball remover around his collar. The monitors are deserted. Miles absently pans a camera over and then sits bolt upright. On the screen he can see Buzz Fazeli, in a room at Babylon Lanes, surrounded by large piles of cash, stuffing rolls of bills into hollow bowling pins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (with rising anger) Why that filthy, slimey, double-crossing, misbegotten, two-faced, mangy, son-of-a- bitch bastard! The motor in the fuzz ball remover SHRIEKS as Miles squeezes it to death. It shatters in his hands. 49     EXT. PARKING FIELD - NIGHT                                 49 Theo and Sheila lie on the roof of the station wagon. "Devil With The Blue Dress" by Shorty Long plays on the stereo. The rest of the party throws marshmallows at each other in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo, what would you do if you couldn't bowl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. It's all I ever wanted to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to be a motocross champion. My folks didn't really care what I did. Then Junior blew a fuse and I became their last hope. Most girls get ballet stuffed down their throats, I got bowling. I never understood how anyone could take it so seriously. I hope I'm not insulting you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you suspended?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to be kind of wild. They used to call me the bad boy of bowling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you're hoping Buzz can get you re- instated?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that was plan A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's plan B?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plan B is your dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think my dad's gonna do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he'd sponsor me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha! And what do you have to do for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh really? Nothing? My dad doesn't do anything unless there's something in it for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked me to keep an eye on you for a couple of days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Be my body guard? (she laughs) Here's my body, Theo. Guard it. For my dad's sake. For your career. Sheila starts to unbutton her bowling shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheila, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Theo, what about plan C?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking worried) What's plan C?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plan C... (opens her shirt, showing off her brassiere) ...is me. Sheila takes Theo's nervous hands and places them inside her shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (torn) Look, Sheila, I really like you but... Sheila rolls on top of him, and plants a hickey on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stopping her) Forget it, Sheila. 50     INT. MILES 'O' LANES                                 50 Kastle hurries through the darkened bowling alley. He stops short as a warning alarm begins to sound from somewhere deep within the building. Lane six lights up and comes to life. Kastle walks slowly forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior? Is that you, Junior? Don't be afraid. Where are you? I won't hurt you. INT. MACHINERY GALLEY Kastle stealthily sneaks along beside row upon row of silent pin reset machines shining a flashlight in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Junior. Everyone's waiting for you, son. The beam of light catches Junior's face. He is crouched inside the machine at lane six. Jr. His face is cut and bleeding and his straitjacket torn and filthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Needs lubrication. Lubrication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're having a party for you, boy. Cake and shish-k-bob, just like you love. Junior cringes away from the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made me hurt him! Kastle reaches into his pocket and pulls a gaudy digital wristwatch from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what I got for you. He holds the watch up in front of Junior. Junior looks curiously at the watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy Birthday Junior! The watch begins to play an electronic version of "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head." Junior's face lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooooooohhh. Kastle begins luring Junior out of machine number six with the watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have someone for you to play with Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone wants to play with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have someone for you to play Blueface with Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blueface! Blueface is my favorite. 51     EXT. ROAD, SID & BREEZE'S CAR - DAY                      51 Breeze and Sid speed down a road in their damaged hulk. The TENOR of Enrico Caruso can be heard from inside. 51     INT. SID & BREEZE'S CAR                                    51 Breeze drives. Sid gazes out the window. Enrico Caruso WAILS from the car stereo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowling used to be so pure, so...All- American. Breeze sings along with Caruso and pretends to conduct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: La da da dalala...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking heatedly disturbed) I hate fuckin' opera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you hate opera, Sid? Opera has all the drama and excitement of real life - to music!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know, you don't even speak Latin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You listen to the feelings, not the words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got an 8-track tape player on purpose, just 'cause you knew the only thing they had on 8-track was fuckin' opera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a clearance. Sid seems to calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wistfully) You know, Elvis bowled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kiddin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowling was the most incorruptible sport. No megalomillionaires, no (more)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gambling. And it was a safe place for kids, a place where the whole community could meet for some wholesome, clean fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sympathetically) Sure, Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (becoming rabid) But not no more. Now people take advantage. Bowling ain't what it used to be. There's something evil spreading in this sport - like a big, gigantic, puss- ridden -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting excited) - canker sore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (apoplectic) Right, eating at the core, eating it's way out. It makes me sick! Sid starts pressing buttons on the tape deck
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you turn this thing off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! That's an aria! Sid and Breeze struggle for the cassette. The music DISTORTS into a warbling gurgle of an aria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme that! Sid yanks the cassette out, but the tape becomes tangled in the player. He pulls at the endless yards of tape and throws the whole mess out the window. 52     EXT. PETER PAN DINER - DAY                                 52 Theo, wearing sunglasses and dressed in a jogging suit similar to Miles Kastle's, steps out of the diner with a bag containing four orange whips. He goes over to his parked car. Buzz walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in deadly serious) Theo, I want you to get out of this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm getting to like it here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did that porcupine say he'd get you back on the tour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) He'll be a barnacle on your ass the rest of your life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a better offer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't think so. Theo takes a long drag from his orange whip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for somebody who hit a man with his ball on national television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bitterly) That's right, Buzz, and you know when I did it? Last match, last frame. All I needed was one spare for the crown - and I get stuck with the seven-ten, the Fazeli Split.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never even took the shot. You couldn't do it. Theo moves towards Buzz in a threatening manner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (repressed fury in his voice) I was beaten on a shot named after my own dad. The moment passes. Theo turns and climbs into his car. He looks up at Buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, kid, gimme a break. I'm an old man. (taps chest) I'm runnin' on a Delrin aorta. I'm finished - dead from my ankles up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't care less. Theo starts his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I think? You didn't come here to find a father. You didn't even come here for help. You just came here to take it all out on somebody. Well it ain't gonna be me! Theo pulls out of the parking lot. Buzz yells after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (at the top of his lungs)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! 53     EXT. KASTLE HOUSE, GARAGE                                  53 The Kastle home is a huge nouveau riche Brady Bunch style house with a large deck jutting over the driveway. The doors are open on the spacious two car garage. Sheila has the headset of her Vespa disassembled. Theo walks up the driveway, orange whips in hand.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: I SHOULDA HAD MY TUBES TIED

direction.raw_text: I don't think your new outfit suits you, Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flicking dust off the suit) Really? I kinda like it. He sits nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you talk with your mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been awhile. She didn't want me looking for my dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom told me not to stay in this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why do you stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a credit card junkie. I went on a binge and my dad bailed me out. Now I'm trapped in his easy payment plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you get to meet a lot of eligible bowlers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but they're all little wannabes. I'm looking for a professional man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he ponders the thought) I may not be a pro bowler, but I'm no amateur man. Sheila moves closer to Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touches his lips) How much would you charge me for the lips?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than you could afford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, bargain with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could let them go for ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she pulls away, slightly) You professional men drive a hard bargain. I'm afraid I only have five on me. Sheila pulls out a 5 dollar bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) If you want a professional man, you have to be willing to pay for him. 54     EXT. KASTLE HOUSE, DECK                                    54 Sheila and Theo stand on the deck. Sheila scans the road leading to the house with binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do about your brother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the guy he put in the body cast?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The road is empty
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Momentary relapse. Except for that, he's been making progress. Sheila laughs. Theo nervously pulls his collar up over the hickey on his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior is like a faithful doggy. He loves his birthday so much, that every year, before we can go pick him up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kastle's car appears, driving hell-for- leather towards the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...he breaks out of the hospital and comes home on his own. Here they come. She hands the binoculars to Theo, who immediately trains them on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mom once had an affair. When my dad found out, he had Junior kill the man. The body was never found, but I think Junior took him to the alley. Theo lowers the binoculars and looks at Sheila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then it's true, isn't it? About...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...lane six. Yes. 55     EXT. KASTLE HOUSE, DRIVEWAY                                55 Kastle's car comes belly-flopping to a stop in front of the house. Kastle climbs out and gesticulates wildly to the couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a loud whisper) He's here! Come on down! BLACKNESS INSIDE THE TRUNK KASTLE (OS) (muffled)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hats on everybody. SOUNDS of the group gathering outside can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muffled) Dad, this is ridiculous. Just open it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muffled) Ssssh! Now real quiet. On three. One...two...three! The lid flies up and Kastle, Sheila, and Theo stand there, with party hats and party horns in their mouths. They all cheer and throw confetti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprise! Kastle takes a flash snapshot. Junior, lying on some folded blankets in the trunk, looks at his family with a stunned expression. He is in a straitjacket. Junior's new watch begins to PLAY "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head". He struggles to pull his arm out, but can't. Kastle reaches in to untie the straitjacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steady boy, steady. Untied, Junior presses the BEEPING watch against his ear. His face breaks into a beatific smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 56     EXT. KASTLE HOUSE, PICNIC TABLE - AFTERNOON                    56 Kastle pulls shish kebab chunks off a skewer. He looks down to see that one of the chunks is a melted Ken head. He throws it away in disgust.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I bet you didn't know that you and Junior have something in common, Theo: Junior can't bowl anymore either. Isn't that right Junior? Kastle SLAMS the ketchup bottle down on Junior's right hand. The table settings jump from the shock. Junior sits impassively, his face a blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See! No feeling. Tell Theo what happened to your hand, Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After we eat, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stuck it in the ball return machine when he was a kid. Crushed all the nerve endings. Junior starts stroking the ketchup bottle with his dead hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not so bad. When I'm alone, it feels like someone else. Sheila grabs the bottle from Junior, opens it and pours some on her shish kebab. She leans over and whispers furiously to her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have to get your hooks into every guy I'm interested in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers back, defensively) You're just like you mother! Always jealous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why Mom ran away, because you had to control everything!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She ran away to be with that... (spits out his words) that Motocross champion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn, Theo. Why can't you bowl? Sheila and Kastle sit up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're prone to violent outbursts, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It depends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It feels good to let it out, doesn't it? Sheila leans over and whispers furiously to her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're using Theo for your own deviant purposes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who's talking!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just because your mother signed part ownership of the lanes over to you, doesn't mean you have a right to tell me how to run my business! I can have my lawyers take that deed away from you like that. (snaps his fingers) Sheila and Kastle sit up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior, how 'bout a riddle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns to Sheila) Sheila. Knock-knock. Sheila glances nervously at Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (impatiently) Come on Sheila, knock-knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Junior who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: J'you-and-your-friend do it yet? (laughs)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Fantastic! What talent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (caustically) You still got the touch Junior.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Make a wish, son. Junior stares into Sheila's eyes for several seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same wish as last year. Sheila blows out the candles in a hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It won't come true, Junior. Kastle places a gift-wrapped box in front of Junior and lifts the lid. He reaches in and pulls out a huge, intricate claw- like arm-shaped device made of plastic and metal and covered with cables.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a bowling claw. You can bowl now, Junior. With the whole family. Junior beams at the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Mr. Kastle. (nods to seated party) Junior, long time. I thought they locked you up and threw away the warden!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knock, knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's...

direction.raw_text: Buzz has been moving the cash out in hollow bowling pins. Sid and Breeze throw sideways glances at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Champ, as soon as you get back on the tour, we should do an instructional videotape. 'RAMBOWL' Theo Skinner teaches Power Bowling. You on the cover with a flame thrower. Kastle lights Theo's cigar and they puff away.

direction.raw_text: Nope, I couldn't care less.

direction.raw_text: Why should I help that old fuck.

direction.raw_text: (sarcastically) Yeah, what did Buzz Fazeli ever do for you?

direction.raw_text: Zip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And besides, it's probably too late, anyhow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (exhaling cigar smoke) Way too late. Buzz Fazeli is history. (goes to take another drag, then stops) Too late for what? She turns away.

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late for what, Sheila?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know how people with broken bones know when there's a storm coming?

direction.raw_text: Junior. Theo remains silent.

direction.raw_text: ! (boiling) You're supposed to say JUNIOR WHO! I'm going to have to hurt you. Theo and Junior circle one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You shouldn't touch her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Junior, you shouldn't touch her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody touches her. Except me. I touch her. Sheila told me you played bouncy- bouncy with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did your dad tell you to do to Buzz? Theo scrambles up the lane on hands and knees. Junior catches him, grabbing his ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me to play Blue-Face with Buzz. I like games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (struggling to get away) What did you do to Buzz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You played bouncy-bouncy with Sheila, so I'm gonna play Blue-Face with you. (he grabs Theo's throat)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hoarsely) I don't want to play. Theo stretches to get a nearby ball, but just can't reach it, by millimeters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To play, I press my fingers on a throat like this... (he presses tighter on Theo's windpipe) ...and then the mans face would go blue and I should keep pressing... (Theo's face goes pale blue) ...and I did and then he stopped moving and he didn't play anymore after that. Theo bends back a finger on Junior's hand. Junior lets out a HOWL of pain and releases Theo's neck. Theo GASPS for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't play fair. (stands up) You were almost blue. Theo gets his fingers in a bowling ball and brings it up to bash Junior in the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead Theo, I saw you on TV. I'm your biggest fan. Junior offers Theo his unprotected head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Come on Theo, GIVE ME YOUR AUTOGRAPH! Theo bashes Junior in the head with the ball. It bounces off Junior's head like a Nerf ball and rolls down the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Mr. Skinner! Thank you! Theo desperately, but fruitlessly tries to get away. As he crawls over the ball return trough, Junior puts his foot on Theo's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can have her,you know. (looks around and whispers) She's not my real sister. (he flashes a lecherous smile)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ball pops up at the far end of the return and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rapidly towards Theo. The ball hits Theo's face with a POW. BLACK OUT We HEAR "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head." THEO'S BOWLING SHOE ATTIRED FEET Being dragged down the lane. Theo comes to and looks down his body to see the empty lane. He looks up to see Junior pulling him towards the pin reset machine. The cut on Theo's forehead bleeds down the side of his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muttering) Lubrication. MACHINE NUMBER 6 Junior pulls the dazed Theo into the pin-reset machine and positions him under the pins. As Junior prepares the machinery, a control cable on his claw becomes fouled. Junior begins to thrash about as he tries to disentangle himself and his malfunctioning arm. Theo rolls away as Junior's flailing releases the machine. It comes slamming down on Junior just as Theo slips out of harm's way. He gets up and staggers away from the machine. Junior's HOWL echoes across the lanes. His twitching feet protrude from the maw of the device. Lane six goes dark. Theo limps up the lane.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 64     EXT. BRIDGE                                        64 Theo drives up to the erect draw-bridge. He stops and gets out. The night is silent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (loud whisper) Sheila! Where are you? Sheila pops out of the bushes and walks towards Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) You told Junior that we did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It. Bouncy-bouncy. Fucked. He tried to squeeze my fucking head off. What did you say to him? When they reach each other, they stop. Sheila seems to weigh her answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him you were my boyfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very pissed off) What the hell did you go doing that for Sheila? We haven't even gotten naked yet!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We would have sooner or later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great! He tried to kill me! You knew he would go off if he thought I fooled around with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you - kill him? Theo paces up and down in front of the upright bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you get this thing down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me what happened Theo. Theo backs Sheila towards the bridge control booth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glares at Sheila) You wanted me to kill him, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in shock) If he's not dead, he'll keep coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead Sheila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure he's dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't stop to take his pulse. Theo boosts Sheila up the ladder to the control booth. The hydraulic machinery of the bridge heaves into motion and the bridge begins to lower. Theo walks over to his car. Sheila jumps down from the bridge control booth and follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think your brother may have already gotten to Buzz. He gets into his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I come with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did your dirty work for you Sheila, now fuck off. Theo drives away leaving Sheila standing alone. She watches his car recede with a thoughtful expression, then turns on her heel.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 65     INT. THEO'S CAR - NIGHT                                    65 Theo grips the steering wheel with white knuckles. He nods off at the wheel, the roadway through his eyes wavering and distorting. He hits himself in the face in an effort to keep himself awake. 66     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE - NIGHTMARE                          66 The house is dark except for a light coming from the closed bathroom door. Theo cautiously makes his way to the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (whispers) Buzz? You alright? WATER is running inside. Theo twists the doorknob and opens the door with a jolt. Junior lunges out of the dark, mangled and bloody with bowling pins sticking out of his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you KNOCK? Theo SLAMS the door shut. 67     EXT. BUZZ'S HOUSE - DAWN                                   67 Theo jerks awake. His car is parked by the Fazeli house. It is a clear, blustery day. A gust of wind pulls the screen door open, then SLAMS it shut. He gets out of the car and walks unsteadily towards the house. 68     INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM                         68 Theo walks into the house. The place is completely trashed. Theo picks up a golf ball from the floor. He makes his way to the bathroom door and slowly turns the knob; then pulls back. He picks up a nearby bowling ball and holds it over his head as he reaches for the doorknob. This time, he thrusts the door open. The bathroom is empty. Relieved, he cradles the ball in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thick crimson red fluid trickles down his forearm, dripping off his elbow. Horrified, he pulls his fingers out of the ball. Blood streams out of the three finger holes. He drops the ball to the floor. He goes into the bathroom and turns on the sink faucets. INT. BUZZ'S HOUSE, BATHROOM Water runs as Theo manically washes the blood from his hands and arms. He rinses the blood from the holes of his ball and looks up to the mirror. "NOK NOK" is smeared in blood across his reflection. 69     EXT. 7-ELEVEN PHONE BOOTH - DAY                        69 Theo waits through several rings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, mom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theodore? Where are you? Are you alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead, isn't he. (pauses) Buzz Fazeli might just as well have died before you were born.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, you know I had to do it. I just did it a little too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you're OK Teddy? You're not bowling are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta go. Love ya mom. Theo hangs up the phone. Alfie shuffles over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you hear about that bowler who got smeared? I saw them pull a body bag out of the alley. I heard he was kacked but good. They had to take apart the pin machine to get him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stunned) The pin machine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like Junior did the last time; lane six. All's I know is it's gonna be a closed coffin. My advice to you is to lay low. He puts on a pair of dark 7-Eleven shades, flips up his collar and skulks away. 70     EXT. MILES 'O' LANES                                 70 Theo pulls into the parking lot. The place is cordoned off with day-glo yellow emergency tape printed with "Bowling Police - Do Not Cross". A black bowling police van, its blue light spinning, is parked in front. Bowling cops herd dwarfs and customers into the van. Mothers and daughters mill around behind the yellow tape. A group of little people brandish "Right to Work" signs. Theo gets out of his car. The crowd moves in as Kastle, hands cuffed behind him, emerges from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is! Camera flashes POP all over the place. Two black-jacketed bowling cops step out behind him. They are Sid and Breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bowling police, step back, give him room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing going on here, everybody stand back. Let him through, ladies. Ladies, please. As they start to move through the female throng, a little girl pops out in front of them, holding her ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Kastle, we know you wouldn't do anything bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank-you, sweetheart. (turns to Breeze) See that you pinheads! Character witness. (with sweeping head gesture) They're all character witnesses! (he sees Theo) Thanks to Buzz Fazeli, bowling is dead in this town! He KILLED it! The two officers hustle Kastle towards the van. Theo steps out in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (between clenched teeth) You fool, we could have done great things together!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Junior?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed your stoolie embezzler father, and he's gonna kill you next! Sid and Breeze push him towards the van as the crowd's MURMUR increases. Kastle turns and yells over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting) Lock your daughters up, ladies! Junior's out there! Mothers and daughters send out a cacophony of screams and scatter for their cars. The BP cops hoist Kastle into the back of the van. Sid slams the doors shut. The van screeches off, sirens wailing. Sid and Breeze walk up to Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about your loss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking his head) I should've pegged you guys for bowling dicks from day one.

direction.raw_text: So, Buzz was stooling for you guys.

direction.raw_text: Did you know you were parked in the handicap space?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kastle's daughter's been lookin' for you. Theo gets into his car and starts the engine. Sid and Breeze poke their heads in the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She told us you went after Junior to save your old man's hide. You got some balls goin' after that psycho.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only problem is, you didn't put his lights out, you just got him mad. Then he took it out on poor Faz, God rest his soul. Theo patches out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think he bought it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd buy it! Sid chews his lip worriedly. 71     INT. THEO'S CAR - AFTERNOON                                71 Theo nods off for a second and then snaps back. His eyes seem hypnotized by the lines on the road which seem to swim and undulate unnaturally. He nods again. And snaps again. 72     EXT. PARKING FIELD - TWILIGHT                          72 Theo pulls up to the old party spot and gets out. He walks over the dunes and towards the beached station wagon. A huge flame rises down the beach. A woman is visible in its light, tossing objects into the fire. Theo walks towards her. EXT. BEACH, BONFIRE Sheila is stripping Barbie and Ken dolls and tossing them onto the pyre. Each one goes up in an exaggerated  WHOOSH of flames. She notices Theo when he steps into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once my father walked in on me while I was making Barbie and Ken do it. He freaked. I was seven. He took all my dolls away from me and cut them in half. He gave the top halves back to (more)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: me. Then he made me watch him burn the bottom halves in the fireplace. Theo kneels down nearby and throws a Barbie onto the bonfire. It goes up with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see Junior's face in the fire. Theo puts his hand on Sheila's hand. She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you come back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I'm with you Sheila, I don't even think about bowling. Theo takes Sheila in his arms and kisses her passionately. She stops him and looks around nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If Junior finds us, he'll kill us both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed him once, I'll just have to kill him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't get two chances with Junior.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least I'll die smiling. Sheila pushes him over. He falls backwards, her on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you only get two chances with me. Sheila yanks her shirt over her head and tosses it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shirt CRACKLES and burns. She pulls Theo's head up to her breasts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it gonna be, Theo? A Barbie's breasts blister from the heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & SHEILA Theo bends Sheila backwards, down on her back. She grabs the tail of his shirt, yanks it over his head and off his body. Sheila rubs her hands up Theo's back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the plan, Theo? A Ken back bubbles and melts. Theo lifts Sheila's back off the sand and works her jeans down her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say something, Theo. Give me something. A doll's legs catch fire. Theo stares into Sheila's eyes.
