direction.raw_text: Plan C. From now on it's gonna be plan C. Both bodies throb and grind, their sandy hands sliding over each others' sweaty skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna be you, Sheila. They humpty-hump to the beat of "Scientist's" 'DEMATERIALIZE.' We hear Theo and Sheila's stereophonic MOANING as a Barbie and a Ken doll collapse and vaporize from the blazing heat. We pan up through the flames, the MOANS increasing in volume and intensity as they reach the you-know-what-we've-all-been- waiting-for.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 73     EXT. CEMETERY - DAY                                  73 A coffin moves slowly forward as a solemn DIRGE plays. The top is in the shape of a bowling alley with a miniature black bowling ball inscribed with "The Faz" at the head. The pallbearers; Theo, Breeze, Sid, Tina, and two other bowlers place the coffin on poles above the grave. A rotund priest sprinkles holy water. Sheila stands next to Theo, crying. (more) Theo wears a glazed look. The priest clears his throat with a loud AHEM.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (with pomp and vigor) Bowling! (pauses to reflect) Bowling is a little like faith. Every now and then, we are blessed with the ability and strength to send a full roller down.. (makes bowling gesture) ...and scatter those babies like nobody's business. And every now and then we end up in the gutter. (pauses and gets glum) Buzz Fazeli found himself in the gutter of life. Trapped in hook alley, throwing nothing balls. But before he left us for that pie alley in the clouds, he pulled himself out of that gutter. Buzz Fazeli died cleaning up the sport of bowling. Now he lies at peace alongside his lane brothers here in Bowlers' Field. (makes sign of the cross) He died so that we could bowl - with dignity. Millie, decked out in mourning black, lets out a wail, steps up and throws a bouquet of flowers onto the coffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sniffles) I forgive you Buzz. Sid leans over to Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in loud whisper) The Faz sure took care a her. (points to Millie, does the cash rub with fingers) Breeze makes a nasal GRUNT as he tries to suppress a snigger. Sid - trying to keep a straight face - elbows him. Sid and Breeze approach the coffin. Breeze pulls an orange whip out of a paper bag and carefully places it on the coffin lid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nectar of the bowling gods, Faz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See ya 'round Faz. Tina steps up to the grave with a handful of papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are all your perfect games. (she drops scoresheets onto the coffin) Bowl with God, Buzz. Mourners sniff and cry. The coffin starts descending into the ground. A stiff breeze scatters the scoresheets. Sheila nudges Theo who approaches and tosses a handful of soil into the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you were right Buzz. Maybe I did just come here to take it out on somebody. But, I had to find my father... The muffled BEEPING of "Raindrops Keep Falling On My Head" begins playing from inside the coffin. Theo's body jolts. He runs after Sheila who is walking towards her scooter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz is alive, Sheila. The two sleazeballs gaze surreptitiously at him as they walk towards their car. Theo grabs Sheila's jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo, Buzz is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't come this far to bury a guy that's not my dad. He owes me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bitterly) Back to plan A. The vicious cycle all over again. Theo lets go of Sheila.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been trapped by Miles Kastle my whole life. She walks over to her scooter, and mounts it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now he's the one who's locked up and I'm the one who's free. If I gotta do this alone, I might as well start now. She revs up and peals out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! 74     EXT. CEMETERY PARKING LOT                                  74 As Sid and Breeze walk up to their car, Theo catches up with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is Junior's watch in that coffin? Something stinks around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your time is up, busyboy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who identified the body?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The body was identified along proper Bowling Congress guidelines for processing a bowling related fatality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the next of kin. I should've seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After we ID, we bury the body. Case and casket closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tried to make it look like Junior trashed his place. Junior's underground in that coffin you dicks put him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's splitsville for you. Sid and Breeze back away from Theo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB OUT!:BOWLING LEGEND KACKED BY DWARFSCAM KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's official, you're an orphan. Happy now, busyboy? Theo stares at the newspaper. He lets Sid's fingers drop. 75     EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY                                   75 Sheila speeds along, her Vespa maxing out at 30 mph. From behind her we see Theo's car approaching rapidly. He pulls up beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting and pointing frantically) What makes you think you know me so well that you can give me an ultimatum? Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said anything about an ultimatum? You want to find your father? Get a shovel and start digging. Hurry up, he's probably in Purgatory by now. Sheila makes a pathetic attempt to speed away from Theo. He moves up beside her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really pissing me off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pissing you off? I'm doing what I said I'd do. What the hell are you doing? What about your word?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My word is good, and it'll always be good. When did I ever give my word to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about plan C?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck plan C!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your word is so good, you're never gonna give it to anyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm dumping you to get back into bowling. Well who's dumping who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not dumping you, I'm suspending you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sez you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suck my dick! She speeds ahead. 76     EXT. HIGHWAY                                         76 Theo THUNDERS along in his car. He listens to his SONG over the stereo. Theo digs into his pocket and pulls out the golf ball from Buzz's house. 77     GOLF BALL                                          77 The logo on the ball reads "PARADISE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paradise. The white ball fills the frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers to himself) Paradise. Hmmmm The camera pulls back from the ball to reveal: 78     INT. TROPICAL 7-ELEVEN - DAY                           78 Theo standing in flowery long Bermuda shorts, matching airbrush Luau shirt and 7-11 shades. The woman behind the counter looks like Alfie's twin. (It's actually Alfie in drag.) It's the same store as before, only with a tropical motif. Instead of bowling magazines on the rack, there's Mini- Golf Digest. ALFREDA examines the ball at arm's length, through her bifocals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a mini-golfer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I get you something for the road?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have orange whips?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm from Akron. 79     EXT. BILLBOARD - DAY                                 79 The billboard fills the frame. It reads "Paradise Putt-Putt", and underneath: "A heavenly experience." A motorized cheesy- looking smiling dwarf-angel swings a golden club. EXT. MINI-GOLF COURSE Miniature golf obstacles are bathed in the light of the setting sun. The camera passes a huge cement centaur surrounded by astro-carpeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just hold it loosely with both hands?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, sugar, find the grip that's right for you. Then grasp firmly. The camera weaves past a five foot pink whale with a gaping green mouth leading onto a mini-green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grasp firmly. Then what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Line up where you want it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now swing it out a little to the right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, that's too far. Try a more gentle stroke. It's all in the stroke. Go ahead, now, honey - stroke. As the camera comes around the side of the whale, we see an elderly man in a fire hydrant red sports coat and white slacks hunched over a diminutive fiftyish woman.  His back is to the camera and he is wearing a baseball cap with a plastic halo attached to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strokin'. Here goes nothin'. She swings a club, sending a golf ball puttering into a cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hole in one! You're the queen of stroke!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yippy! Theo strides towards the couple. The man under the halo is (more) Buzz. He raises the club at the approaching Theo, keeping the woman in front of him as a shield. The front of Buzz's cap reads "I'm No Angel."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad? You said you was single.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We ain't married no more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says that to all his wives. As she tries to wiggle away from him, the club conks Buzz on the noodle, squishing his halo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (freeing herself - to Buzz) Geez Maynard, is he telling the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't pay him any mind, sweetheart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a nice guy, Maynard, but if you got two wives - I ain't into no polybigamy. Buzz is silent. He takes the club out of her hand. She steps away - startled - then turns and jogs away. Buzz throws down his club in a fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddam it! I was just about to make a love connection. You sure got a way with women. You show up, women get away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) The whole world thinks you're underground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am underground. Buzz removes his damaged cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could just as easily have been me in that box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you to get lost. You forced yourself into this mess, so the mess accommodated you. Buzz straightens out and carefully remolds the bent out of shape halo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about bowling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes a practice swing) Bowling died for me years ago. Besides, I'm a living dead legend. I'm a hero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a scumbag. Buzz pats his hair down and slips the cap back on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a live scumbag. Theo digs into his pocket and retrieves the golf ball. He tosses it to Buzz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice knowing you, dad. Theo turns and walks towards his car. Buzz pauses and walks after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, eh, you never saw me. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never saw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, kid. (pause) Where are you goin' now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm goin' straight. No more short cuts. Theo gets into the car. Buzz leans in the open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, if straight doesn't work out, you come work for me. (hands Theo his card) Just make sure nobody's following you. Buzz's face is eerily lit by the glow of the sunset, his halo bouncing in the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't mean that stuff I said. I was trying to keep you out of this muddle. I'm glad I didn't have my tubes tied. Oh, and by the way, I made a call for you before I - uh - retired. Buzz takes his card and scrawl on the back with a gold pen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hands the card back) You give Ed Klein of the American Bowling Congress a call. (taps the card) Tell him your Maynard's boy. He's expecting you, and he owes me. He'll getcha back in like Flynn. (pats Theo's cheek) Don't say I never gave you nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cracks a half smile) See ya 'round Maynard. Buzz backs away from the car as Theo peels out in reverse. Buzz stands and watches as Theo pulls away. 80     EXT. MILES 'O' LANES PARKING LOT - DAY                   80 The sign has been changed to "SHEILA'S ALLEY." A sparkling new badass super-chromed Vespa is parked in the handicap zone. The Barbie and Ken dolls are wired to the headlamp. They look incredibly worse for the wear. A parking ticket is nestled between them. Theo's car pulls in nearby. 81     INT. SHEILA'S ALLEY                                  81 Theo walks through the doors and into the alley packed with serious bowling types. As he walks towards the back of the alley, several bowlers stop bowling and stare at him in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo! Howya doin'? Theo walks on. Others greet the conquering hero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Theo! Hey, Theo's back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello there, stranger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still crying) Waaaaaaaaaaah! At the far end, we see Sheila, dressed in a fitted jogging suit, bowling alone on her lane. Bowlers stop and hold their balls at their sides. Sheila notices the whole alley is silent. Theo steps up to the lane, bowling ball bag in hand. As he straps on his wristbrace he peers down the lane and sees a seven-ten split; mule ears.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 82     BLACKNESS                                          82 A loud ZIP and light spills in through three holes. Three fingers approach the holes, blocking out the light once more. With a POP, the fingers leave the holes and the ball hits the lane with a KLUNK. LANE The camera races towards the pins along the maple boards. PINS Two pins loom in the foreground, one at each edge of the screen. The ball slams into the right hand pin in super slow motion with a ROAR. Theo's eyes slowly close. The pin lifts and hurtles slowly across the frame towards its unsuspecting fellow pin. Theo's eyes open. With a reverberating EXPLOSION, the pin is taken out. 83     INT. SHEILA'S ALLEY, THEO & SHEILA                       83 Theo turns to Sheila and takes her in his arms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Very professional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a professional man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (touches his lips) Lips still for sale?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nonchalantly) You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she pulls away, slightly) Can you change something this big? She pulls out a hundred dollar bill.
direction.name: direction
